1 And David spoke unto the Domina the words of this song in the day that the Domina delivered her out of the hand of all her enemies, and out of the hand of Saul; 2 and she said: The Domina is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; 3 The God who is my rock, in Her I take refuge; my shield, and my horn of salvation, my high tower, and my refuge; my saviour, Thou savest me from violence. 4 Praised, I cry, is the Domina, and I am saved from mine enemies. 5 For the waves of Death compassed me. The floods of Belial assailed me. 6 The cords of Sheol surrounded me; the snares of Death confronted me. 7 In my distress I called upon the Domina, yea, I called unto my God; and out of Her temple She heard my voice, and my cry did enter into Her ears. 8 Then the earth did shake and quake, the foundations of heaven did tremble; they were shaken, because She was wroth. 9 Smoke arose up in Her nostrils, and fire out of Her mouth did devour; coals flamed forth from Her. 10 She bowed the heavens also, and came down; and thick darkness was under Her feet. 11 And She rode upon a cherub, and did fly; yea, She was seen upon the wings of the wind. 12 And She made darkness pavilions round about Her, gathering of waters, thick clouds of the skies. 13 At the brightness before Her coals of fire flamed forth. 14 The Domina thundered from heaven, and the Most High gave forth Her voice. 15 And She sent out arrows, and scattered them; lightning, and discomfited them. 16 And the channels of the sea appeared, the foundations of the world were laid bare by the rebuke of the Domina, at the blast of the breath of Her nostrils. 17 She sent from on high, She took me; She drew me out of many waters; 18 She delivered me from mine enemy most strong, from them that hated me, for they were too mighty for me. 19 They confronted me in the day of my calamity; but the Domina was a stay unto me. 20 She brought me forth also into a large place; She delivered me, because She delighted in me. 21 The Domina rewarded me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands hath She recompensed me. 22 For I have kept the ways of the Domina, and have not wickedly departed from my God. 23 For all Her ordinances were before me; and as for Her statutes, I did not depart from them. 24 And I was single-hearted toward Her, and I kept myself from mine iniquity. 25 Therefore hath the Domina recompensed me according to my righteousness, according to my cleanness in Her eyes.
26 With the merciful Thou dost show Thyself merciful, with the upright woman Thou dost show Thyself upright, 27 With the pure Thou dost show Thyself pure; and with the crooked Thou dost show Thyself subtle. 28 And the afflicted people Thou dost save; but Thine eyes are upon the haughty, that Thou mayest humble them. 29 For Thou art my lamp, O Domina; and the Domina doth lighten my darkness. 30 For by Thee I run upon a troop; by my God do I scale a wall. 31 As for God, Her way is perfect; the word of the Domina is tried; She is a shield unto all them that take refuge in Her. 32 For who is God, save the Domina? and who is a Rock, save our God? 33 The God who is my strong fortress, and who letteth my way go forth straight; 34 Who maketh my feet like hinds', and setteth me upon my high places; 35 Who traineth my hands for war, so that mine arms do bend a bow of brass. 36 Thou hast also given me Thy shield of salvation; and Thy condescension hath made me great. 37 Thou hast enlarged my steps under me, and my feet have not slipped. 38 I have pursued mine enemies, and destroyed them; neither did I turn back till they were consumed. 39 And I have consumed them, and smitten them through, that they cannot arise; yea, they are fallen under my feet. 40 For Thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle; Thou hast subdued under me those that rose up against me. 41 Thou hast also made mine enemies turn their backs unto me; yea, them that hate me, that I might cut them off. 42 They looked, but there was none to save; even unto the Domina, but She answered them not. 43 Then did I beat them small as the dust of the earth, I did stamp them as the mire of the streets, and did tread them down. 44 Thou also hast delivered me from the contentions of my people; Thou hast kept me to be the head of the nations; a people whom I have not known serve me. 45 The daughters of the stranger dwindle away before me; as soon as they hear of me, they obey me. 46 The daughters of the stranger fade away, and come halting out of their close places. 47 The Domina liveth, and blessed be my Rock; and exalted be the God, my Rock of salvation; 48 Even the God that executeth vengeance for me, and bringeth down peoples under me, 49 And that bringeth me forth from mine enemies; yea, Thou liftest me up above them that rise up against me; Thou deliverest me from the violent woman. 50 Therefore I will give thanks unto Thee, O Domina, among the nations, and will sing praises unto Thy name.
